title: Private program email forwarding response invitation not expire after first use.
content:
Summary:
Hi Hackerone Team,
Before i reported that email forwarding of private can be enumerated and any user join to private program here #201369 , but this seems by design, but now it i found a related issue which can cause a security impact on private program because the email forwarding response of HackerOne did not expire after first use.
Description (Include Impact):
If a user Quits to a private program, this user can rejoined without the knowledge of private program owners, also you can check further if the user become Banned it seems that the linked on email still not expire and this can cause security implication if the banned user can rejoined to the program without the knowledge of the program owner, for reproduction steps please see below.
Steps To Reproduce
Send a test mail to █████████ which is private and have email forwarding setup.
Click and follow the link on the email response and you become auto invited to the program (intentional).
NO NOT submit the test report (means the email link already used, but you did not continue to submit the report, you are now participants to the program).
Now Quit to the program.
Go to email and click the same link and you can get back without requesting another link (using submit report via email forwarding)
Link on the email response of forwarding feature should expire after first use
{F164319}
Impact:
When the user quits, or if the program owner dicided to remove/banned the user on participating private program, the user should not get back unless the program owners decide to un-banned and the user/researcher gets invited again.
Mitigation:
The email forwarding feature should expire after it's first use, do not allow the attacker to reused the link to join to the program.
Please ask if you need more information.
Regards
Japz
steps: Send a test email to a private program with email forwarding enabled.
Click the link in the email response to auto-invite yourself to the program (do not submit a test report).
Quit the program, then reuse the same email link to rejoin without needing a new invitation.
Observe that the link remains valid even after quitting or being banned, allowing rejoining without the program owner's knowledge.
vuln_description: The email forwarding response link for private programs does not expire after first use, allowing users to rejoin the program even after quitting or being banned, without the program owner's knowledge or consent.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding the email forwarding feature's behavior, the program's invitation mechanism, and the non-expiry of links. However, the steps to reproduce are straightforward once the initial behavior is observed.
